file_content.text: Thank you. Those supplies will go a long way to keeping this outpost running.
Talk to our quartermaster. She'll set you in the right direction.
Master Jedi. What brings you to our small corner of Republic space? This is such a great, great honor.
Even a forgotten planet can harbor dark secrets.
I have personal business.
They hear there's a party, you can't beat 'em away.
You know these Jedi....
It's not as big an honor as you'd think.
I felt that way once.
Lieutenant. It's good to see a soldier of your reputation slumming with us out here in the wilds of Taris.
There are important objectives here for our war with the Empire.
Your post is important.
We've slummed in much worse places.
This is nothing.
All of us have been taken down unexpected paths by the machinations of the Sith.
We go where we're needed.
Welcome to Taris. I hear you've done the Republic a good turn in the past, so I'm sorry not to have a warmer welcome for you.
Don't be too sorry. You still have to lock up your valuables.
Might be a good thing.
Aren't you still hungover from the last "warm welcome"?
We'll live.
We usually need to be more concerned with a "warm farewell."
Hold your apologies.
Was that a veiled request for help?
I do what I can.
You look worried.
Uh, we're having some trouble, nothing you could have predicted, but... there you are.
Our bases here are far from self-sufficient. We're not farmers, and there's no existing infrastructure here to work with.
We're at the mercy of our supply ships. And this month's just went nose-down in some of the worst territory on Taris.
I'm not really here to chat.
Actually, I was just leaving.
Well, whatever brings you here, I suggest you don't stay long. We've barely got stores enough for our stationed soldiers, much less visitors.
At this rate, I've got men scalping ration cubes for a half week's salary.
If the outpost's in trouble, I'd be happy to help.
Anything I can do?
I just might take you up on that.
I can't believe the Republic sent you out here without sufficient supplies.
What happened?
Oh, we get supplies. Every month. Shipped in from Ord Mantell.
Problem is, this month's ship went nose-down into some of the worst territory on Taris.
It'll take another month before the next one arrives, and in the meantime, my men are stewing their gloves.
Where's the ship? I don't care if it's at the bottom of a swamp.
I can get your supplies.
Is the ship lost? Why haven't your men recovered the supplies?
Did you go after it?
So, deal with it.
Oh, we'll live. But you know soldiers--spend half their paychecks on pazaak, then wonder why they've got nothing left for a rainy day.
Lot of discipline slips since the reduced rations went into effect, though. Almost let a rakghoul right through the perimeter.
It'd be a great service to the Republic if you want to help us out....
No one should be left to starve while serving the Republic.
Of course.
The Republic thanks you for your service.
What would that entail?
Every package you recover from the crash site means another week we can hold out at full strength.
Our men tried to reach the ship once, but they turned back after taking serious casualties. They said it's more than just rakghouls, but couldn't make an ID.
You still want to go, you'll need to talk to our quartermaster at the supply shed across the base. She's got the exact coordinates of the crash.
I've got bigger business than picking up your groceries.
Not my job. [Refuse quest]
It'll be fine. [Refuse quest]
You're probably right. It's just bellyaching. I mean, how much water does a man need, anyway?
The supply ship is coming. I don't know what everyone's so upset about.
